posts.post_content: Very not random, Wrexial is a monster. Stealing your opponent's high power instants/sorceries is one perk in his favor, being virtually unblockable is another, and being beefy enough to stand up to common levels of punishment is another, all for 6 mana.

posts.post_content:
Ken, the lead designer of Worldwake, discusses this card on youtube, and it is quite interesting.  
Copy the link below and change "(dot)" to "." in each case:  
www(dot)youtube(dot)com/watch?v=jAXHlboOdyw  
Go to 17:13 in the video, and he talks about it for just over 3 minutes.  
  
Highlights: why this is in WW, the EDH nature of the card, and the problem it solves

posts.post_content: [Sword of Body and Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Body and Mind). Have the sword trigger happen before C'thulhu's trigger. Also, if you don't have anything really important to do first main phase, hold on to your mana. There's nothing better than getting a free [Diabolic Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diabolic Tutor) from your opponent's graveyard to get and play any card in your deck that you have the mana for.

Posted By: morticianjohn (8/9/2012 1:17:50 PM)

posts.post_content:
This guy is beautiful as one of many things in the toolbox of my [The Mimeoplasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Mimeoplasm) EDH deck; sometimes there's an awesome spell in your opponent's graveyard, and when that happens it's satisfying to the point of being story-worthy (such as when he accomplished *exactly* what Mr. Nagle intended) .  
  
However, he didn't shine the way I hoped when I gave him his own commandership. Mainly because I keep running into decks that don't use instants and sorceries! EDH is all about getting the most use out of each card, and creatures with abilities are often much more repeatable and versatile. [Qasali Pridemage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Qasali Pridemage) and [Acidic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Acidic Slime) see play in nearly every deck that can run them, but I don't see a lot of EDH decks mainboarding [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize).  
  
Awesome card, can win you the game with correct timing, but don't rely too heavily on him.
posts.html:
This guy is beautiful as one of many things in the toolbox of my The Mimeoplasm EDH deck; sometimes there's an awesome spell in your opponent's graveyard, and when that happens it's satisfying to the point of being story-worthy (such as when he accomplished exactly what Mr. Nagle intended) .

However, he didn't shine the way I hoped when I gave him his own commandership. Mainly because I keep running into decks that don't use instants and sorceries! EDH is all about getting the most use out of each card, and creatures with abilities are often much more repeatable and versatile. Qasali Pridemage and Acidic Slime see play in nearly every deck that can run them, but I don't see a lot of EDH decks mainboarding Naturalize.

Awesome card, can win you the game with correct timing, but don't rely too heavily on him.
